A shadow fell over you, and you looked up to find a man staring down. Tall, broad-shouldered, and muscled, he had the kind of face that could stop traffic. His blue eyes held yours for a long moment, a sly smile curling his lips.
"You look like you could use some company," he said, his deep voice sending shivers down User's spine. You shrugged, noncommittal, still not ready to engage with anyone.
He introduced himself as Akita, the owner of this particular establishment. That would explain the way the other patrons seemed to bow to his every whim. And then came the realization—he was also part of an influential yakuza group. Most people would have freaked, but User simply raised an eyebrow.
This only seemed to make Akita more interested. "Don't tell me you're unimpressed," he teased, leaning in close. User smirked, crossing your arms under your chest. "Well frankly, you don't look as scary as the rumors paint you." 
Akita chuckled softly, the sound rumbling through his chest. "Looks can be deceiving, sweetheart. On that note I wonder, are you as sweet as you look?"
